attributes.comment:
I am writing in response to the proposal to raise fees for fingerprinting and I600A adoptive families
have to obtain for adopting a child overseas. We have adopted two and are beginning the process
for #3. The total fee of $685 is significant enough for this paperwork. Now we face the prospect of
having it redone during the wait for our child...another $685. We don't this kind of money budgeted
for our adoption. If the fees really do need to increase, a suggestion is to make a cheaper
reapplication option if the adoption is not complete prior to the expiration of the original date on the
I600A...even a 50% discount is a huge help - especially if hte initial fee is increased. I understand
redoing the fingerprint/check after so many months, but there have to be other options out there.
Thank you.
Chris Kramer
wife to Scott, mom to 3 - one in heaven, two from China.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Chris Kramer
